sidescroller

Class SideScroller

  • java.lang.Object
    • processing.core.PApplet
      • sidescroller.SideScroller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    processing.core.PConstants

    public class SideScroller
extends processing.core.PApplet

    SideScroller Class

    The SideScroller class is the main class. It extends the processing applet, and is the heart of the game.

        public void setup()
        setup is called once at the beginning of the game. Most variables will be initialized here.

        public void load()
        This is where any needed assets will be loaded.

      • draw

        public void draw()
        draw is called once per frame and is the game loop. Any update or displaying functions should be called here.
        Overrides:
        draw in class processing.core.PApplet

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed()
        keyPressed decides if the key that has been pressed is a valid key. if it is, it is then added to the keys ArrayList, and the keyPressedEvent flag is set.
        Overrides:
        keyPressed in class processing.core.PApplet

      • keyReleased

        public void keyReleased()
        keyReleased decides if the key pressed is valid and if it is then removes it from the keys ArrayList and keyReleaseEvent flag is set.
        Overrides:
        keyReleased in class processing.core.PApplet

      • keyPress

        public boolean keyPress(int k)
        checks if the key pressed was valid, then returns true or false if the key was accepted. This method is called when determining if a key has been pressed.
        Parameters:
        k - (int) the key that we are determining is valid and has been pressed.
        Returns:
        boolean key has or has not been pressed.

        public void setScene(java.lang.String s)
        Sets the scene to be used.
        Parameters:
